class_features.description: Make an attack roll using Strength against a target within range. If you glance, you can give up other glancing effects to reduce armor style by one.
class_features.name: Sundering Strike

class_features.description: When you drop to 0 HP or gain the \
injury, you do not fall unconscious, though you still make death saving throws.  All your actions have disadvantage, and all actions against you have advantage.
class_features.name: Too Stupid to Die

class_features.description: If you attack with a martial melee weapon on a slow attack, add the dice together instead of taking the highest one.
class_features.name: Strength of Mountains

class_features.description: Whenever you take a move action, you move as though you had spent 2 more ticks.
class_features.name: Step of the Wild

class_features.description: Choose one creature within Long range and make a Power roll using your Constitution score. On a success against the target’s Wisdom defense, the target is frightened of you until the end of combat.
class_features.name: Barbaric Yawp

class_features.description: Whenever an effect would allow you to spend a Hit Die, you can instead spend 1d4 instead of 2d4.
class_features.name: Hit Die Splitting

class_features.description: You can move and attack on the same turn.  You pay the full tick cost
class_features.name: Charge

primary.feature: Everyone Has a Price: You can pay people 75 Gold to function as a scroll of Charm Person.
primary.name: Everyone Has a Price
primary.feature_desc: You can pay people 75 Gold to function as a scroll of Charm Person.
primary.description: You can pay people 75 Gold to function as a scroll of Charm Person.

secondary.feature: Darkvision: You can see in the dark out to a range of 60 feet.
secondary.name: Darkvision
secondary.feature_desc: You can see in the dark out to a range of 60 feet.
secondary.description: You can see in the dark out to a range of 60 feet.

Berserk.name: Barbaric Yawp

Nature.description: Whenever you take a move action, you move as though you had spent 2 more ticks.
Nature.name: Step of the Wild

Endurance.description: Whenever an effect would allow you to spend a Hit Die, you can instead spend 1d4 instead of 2d4.
Endurance.name: Hit Die Splitting

required_for.description: When you drop to 0 HP or gain the \
injury, you do not fall unconscious, though you still make death saving throws.  All your actions have disadvantage, and all actions against you have advantage.
required_for.name: Too Stupid to Die

Endurance.description: When you drop to 0 HP or gain the "Death" injury, you do not fall unconscious, though you still make death saving throws.  All your actions have disadvantage, and all actions against you have advantage.

requires.description: Whenever an effect would allow you to spend a Hit Die, you can instead spend 1d4 instead of 2d4.

Slashing.description: Whenever you hit a creature with a slashing attack, if you surpass the AC of adjacent creatures, you can deal a glancing hit to them.
Slashing.name: Dervish I

required_for.description: As Dervish, but the hits on adjacent creatures are full hits instead of glancing hits.
required_for.name: Dervish II

Slashing.description: When you score a critical hit using a power with the slashing tag, you deal an additional point of damage.
Slashing.name: Critical I

required_for.description: When you score a critical hit using a power with the slashing tag, you double your damage.
required_for.name: Critical II

Slashing.description: As Dervish, but the hits on adjacent creatures are full hits instead of glancing hits.
Slashing.name: Dervish II

requires.description: Whenever you hit a creature with a slashing attack, if you surpass the AC of adjacent creatures, you can deal a glancing hit to them.
requires.name: Dervish I

Slashing.description: When you score a critical hit using a power with the slashing tag, you double your damage.
Slashing.name: Critical II

requires.description: When you score a critical hit using a power with the slashing tag, you deal an additional point of damage.
requires.name: Critical I

Slashing.description: Whenever you score a critical hit with a slashing spell, the target takes another point of damage at the start of your next turn.
Slashing.name: Critical Bleeding

requires.description: Whenever you score a critical hit with a slashing spell, the target takes another point of damage at the start of your next turn.
requires.name: Critical Bleeding

required_for.description: Whenever you score a critical hit with a slashing spell, the target takes another point of damage at the start of your next turn.
required_for.name: Critical Bleeding

Bludgeoning.description: If the attack beats the target’s Composure Defence, they can’t take reactions until their next turn.
Bludgeoning.name: No Reaction

required_for.description: If the attack beats the target’s Composure Defence, they can’t take reactions until their next turn, and can’t take the same action on their next turn they took on their previous turn
required_for.name: Mind Spike

Bludgeoning.description: If the attack beats the target’s Endurance Defence, it knocks them prone
Bludgeoning.name: Prone

Bludgeoning.description: If the attack beats the target’s Athletics Defence, you can push them back 5*proficiency modifier feet
Bludgeoning.name: Bull Rush

required_for.description: If the attack beats the target’s Athletics Defence, it knocks them prone
required_for.name: Disarm

Bludgeoning.description: If the attack beats the target’s Insight Defence, attacks against the target have advantage until the end of your next turn
Bludgeoning.name: Attack Advantage

Bludgeoning.description: If the attack beats the target’s Athletics Defence, it knocks them prone
Bludgeoning.name: Disarm

requires.description: If the attack beats the target’s Athletics Defence, you can push them back 5*proficiency modifier feet
requires.name: Bull Rush

Bludgeoning.description: If the attack beats the target’s Composure Defence, they can’t take reactions until their next turn, and can’t take the same action on their next turn they took on their previous turn
Bludgeoning.name: Mind Spike

requires.description: If the attack beats the target’s Composure Defence, they can’t take reactions until their next turn.
requires.name: No Reaction

Piercing.description: When you score a glancing hit with a piercing spell, you can inflict an injury (without dealing damage) without provoking opportunity attacks.
Piercing.name: Glance True

required_for.description: You score a glancing hit against a creature on a roll that equals 10 minus their AC, rather than 5 minus their AC.
required_for.name: Constant Glancing

required_for.description: When you score a glancing hit with a piercing effect, the next glancing hit against the target before the end of your next turn is a normal hit.
required_for.name: Lead the Way

Piercing.description: When you score a glancing hit with a piercing effect, the next glancing hit against the target before the end of your next turn is a normal hit.
Piercing.name: Lead the Way

requires.description: When you score a glancing hit with a piercing spell, you can inflict an injury (without dealing damage) without provoking opportunity attacks.
requires.name: Glance True

Piercing.name: Constant Glancing

requires.description: When you score a glancing hit with a piercing spell, you can inflict an injury (without dealing damage) without provoking opportunity attacks.
requires.name: Glance True

required_for.description: When you score a glancing hit with a piercing spell, you can inflict a point of damage (without rolling for an injury) without provoking opportunity attacks.
required_for.name: Glance Deep
